name: Defender's Quest: Valley of the Forgotten (DX edition)
description: Defender's Quest is a Tower-Defense/RPG Hybrid tightly focuses on three things: tactical depth, customization, and story.
minimum_requirements: OS:Windows XP Processor:1.5 Ghz, single core Memory:1 GB RAM Graphics:N/A Hard Drive:100 MB HD space Sound:Any
recommended_requirements: OS:Windows XP or better Processor:(2.0 Ghz, single core) or better Memory:2 GB RAM Graphics:N/A Hard Drive:100 MB HD space Sound:Any

reviews.review_text: For me the best tower defence ever.  And just short of four years after the release here come a wonderful HD remaster. For FREE! Great game from great developer

A great game that combines the best of RPG and tower defence. There's enough challenge and you don't need to devote a lot of time at a time like some RPGs require you to do. All around great title and well worth the money.

I've played a lot of tower defense. I used to play Warcraft III custom maps where the tower defense genre was cut from. Defender's Quest does a nice job of putting a well developed story with well developed characters into tower defense gameplay without it feeling pasted on.   It keeps it simple. There are only a few basic towers to choose from, but each tower acts like a character in your party and you can equip most of them with weapons and armor (no weapons or armor for a dragon and no armor for the barbarian/main melee guy). The maps are laid out well enough that consideration to where to place your troops does make a big difference.  There is also a nice take on the gameplay by offering 4 difficulty levels. You get rewards for completing the level, but you get bonus rewards for not taking a single point of damage. If you do that, you can get a lot of extra scrap (money) and unique items.  What I'm doing on my second playthrough is going as far as I possibly can while only buying recruits and never any items on the easiest mode. When I hit my first failure, I go back to the very start and try to complete each level on the hardest mode possible. After I fail once, I will go down to an easier mode and so on until I am right back at the easiest mode and therefore, the furthest out I've ever been.  The main game is not that long and there isn't a ton of replayability to this game once you complete it. That is why it is only worth a few bucks...but it's worth a few bucks. I hear they are making a Defender's Quest II and I hope that is at least as good. Even when it is, this is still a pretty fun tower defense and something that feels more refreshing than you might think when you come back to it after a long time.

Well, reviewing a title that is available for 2 years now seems useless, yet i'll do it anyway :-)  Judging by the graphics i wonder why i even bought it. Maybe because i like Tower-Defense-Games. But i was suprised with this cute little quillet.  What exactly is it? It's a TD-Game without towers. But with people. Typical RPG-People like berzerkers, mages, healers and rangers and... And you'll keep your 'Towers' throughout the game and they'll receive XP and level-up. You can even color them and give them names. You move through a story with cutscenes, but mainly you'll fight waves of enemies with your party.   The good:     Borderless fullscreen AKA non-exclusive Fullscreen. Yay. Scaled to your resolution OR changed resolution. Nifty!    Don't like the speed of advancement? Change XP/monetary reward to 300%! Or 50%.    Leveling and outfitting your 'towers' is a nice approach. You'll have veterans and noobs to place on each map.    Speed adjustment from 0x (pause) to 4x. Nice. Pausable at all times. No pressure there.    You can adjust your partymembers fighting tactics and even make them persistant (attack which target first, use high power abilities on lower foes etc.)    Beside your party you'll have your main hero that has misc. spells at her disposal.    TD-like you can play each map in different difficulties with proportional rewards. It pays to replay an older mission on EXPERT!    The way they make you 'like' their facebook/twitter-page was really cute. I almost felt bad NOT to click :-)    Workshop! For those extra hours to waste    It has a real story with cute cutscenes. I admit to have skipped much of it, but for some it may add immersion.    The bad:     For some, it may possibly lack depth of strategy/difficulty. It looks more like a 'casual' tower-defense.    Ok, to be nit-picky: The skills you're able to choose are too few. No big descisions to make, you're getting them all more or less anyway.    TL;DR:  Bought 'Defenders of time' at the same time and it seemed much more promising. Oh boy was i wrong. Kicked 'DoT' off of my HD after 2 minutes and played this one for hours. Graphics is not everything. This is a fun and refreshing towerdefense-game where you keep your 'towers' and level them up. Also you'll try to outfit them with better weapons and armor. I surely had my fun. Would be even worth fullprice!
awesome tower defence game

While this is a decent little game, I think it fails to really deliver on its core promises. It's worth some money and time, but I wouldn't recommend paying full price for it.  The game bills itself as primarily a tower defense game. Tower defense games generally require you to come up with a strategy to defeat the enemies given a particular map and set of resources. Defender's Quest maps are much simpler, and to a large extent don't require much strategy. That's where the 'RPG' part comes in. There's not really any role-playing going on, but your characters get stronger and you can buy better weapons and armor for them. The maps don't rely so much on strategy as on having characters that are high enough level and have good enough equipment. And that generally means grinding for XP. So when it comes to the advanced and extreme levels, it's not that the levels are possible but you have to have a better strategy. The levels are simply impossible to start with, and the only way you can beat them is by leveling up your characters.  In short, it's not a good tower defense game (because the challenges rely primarily on having high-level characters not strategy), and it's not a good RPG (because there's no real role-playing, just 'numbers going up' as you and the enemy gain levels and equipment). So I think it rather fails the 'tactical depth' promise.  The second promise is customization, and it does have options to rebind all the keys and change the XP scaling, character names and colors, etc., but I don't think it's a big deal. The developer also put thought into how he could accomodate people with certain disabilities (like epilepsy), which is nice.  The third is story, and I suppose that's where this game does best. The story isn't great, but it does give a reason to keep playing and it is fairly humorous in some parts.  Technically, the game is well-made, even if it appears dated. I can't recall any bugs in the game, and it has been very stable. The game runs at 800x600 resolution, which is fine for me. The sound effects and music are well-done, but lack variety, which is okay for me.  I just wish the game rewarded thinking more than it rewards grinding. It's worth a try if you can get it on sale.

God damn it.... Ok. i'll be honest here. I got this yesterday afternoon as I was looking for something cheap to test STEAM's return policy. Idea was to install it, and boom, kick it out.   So here I was ... 4h later, farming lavels to get loads of money to buy new weapons and going through the story ... Ha! Joke on me i guess. But... all in all if I didnt mind spending over 4h on a first go of a game it deserves thumbs up.   Great job - a tidy little game. If you are into tower defence, it is a nice gem.
Probably the best Tower Defense game currently on Steam.  Great game, great art, great music and great developers!

Hugely addictive game - I couldn't stop playing it. A really well thought out mix of tower defense and RPG. Well balanced and hugely customisable, you can make the game as easy or as hard as you want. Forget the lo-fi graphics, this is all about the gameplay and on that front it delivers. Good to hear the game was a success for the devs and they're thinking about a sequel.
Funny, stylish, not easy. A story driven tower defence game. Recommended.

Incredibly fun game. Usually, I am not the type to enjoy a 'Tower Defense' game, but this one had many RPG elements (levelling characters, buying new equipment) seamlessly added into it that have made this one of my favorite games that I've run across in awhile. I highly recommend it!
it's a badass tower defense game without the microtransaction bs....seriously.....buy this...

Defender's Quest breathes new life into the dusty genre of tower defense by mixing it with the story and characters of a role-playing game. I must warn you that it is incredibly addictive; it contains oodles of extra content as well as multiple rewards for choosing more difficult paths through the game. And once you're done with it all, you can begin anew to see if you can complete the famed 'Hero Mode'. Add in mod support and a gracious team of developers and you can see why this game has something for everyone.

It won't seem like it at first, but this is a seriously addictive game. While the resolution does suck, it's not worth giving up on the game just for that reason and you get over it pretty quickly. DQ is a lot of fun, and is the perfect game for those days where you're not 100% sure what game you fancy playing.
Really fun TD game, best I have ever played. Also has great writing (and an actual story, unlike other TD games) and great music.

You may have some qualms about paying fifteen bucks for a game that looks like it should be a free Flash game (the art style doesn't help it in this case), but this game is worth it.  Plenty of maps, difficulty settings, and bonus content. Freely adjustable experience and currency drops. allowing you to make the game easier or harder to your liking. An engaging and genuinely funny story with likable and amusing characters. The absolute best implementation of a New Game+ mechanic I've ever seen. And I find the art style endearing, personally.
I spent an hour killing a level 1 super sheep. 10/10

This game, and it's developers, is (are) awesome. This is one of the few games that I own that is worth more than the full price of the game not on sale. I'm sorry for being so serious in this review, and not alluding to the amount of games I own or the amount of money I make per year, which is just tons and tons (refering to both), but I'm watching 'A Silver Linings Playbook', and I'm a little emotional right now, so give me a freaking break.
oh man its a good game. i have not fallen down this deep a tower defense hole in years. someone send help i am drowning in a great game. gonna be a smiling corpse.

tower defense crossed with Strategy RPG  each 'tower' is a unique character that levels up and learns skills. there's like 30 stages with 4 difficulties on each one, and a new game + mode making even more longer and lots of unlockable equipment and stages. ...oh and if it matters you can change the exp/money rate up to like 300%, or down to 25% so you can adjust the pace (i'm sure most would just put 100% though)
Fantastic game - just buy it already!

Defender's Quest is a novel rpg take on the tower defense genre. That in and of itself would make an interesting game, but the designers saw fit to include an interesting story to explain away the game mechanics as part of the plot. While the central theme of plague and the risen dead is dark, the dialogue between characters is lighthearted and oftentimes funny. Such a combination of serious undertones and bright interplay amongst the characters helped me enjoy the game quite a bit.  Insofar as the actual mechanics are concerned, this is not a 'maze building' tower defense game. The enemies will come in waves along pre-defined paths with limited placement for your defenders (the towers, essentially) available. Defenders can be upgraded by 'boosting' them through five levels which unlocks any abilities they may have earned through levelling and a rudimentary talent system. Speaking of levelling, this is where the rpg mechanic comes into play; every level gained by a defender gives you talent points which you can use to tweak the character and gain new abilities. While the talent system is very basic, it does give you a feeling of satisfaction to distribute your points when a defender levels or you gain access to a new class.   While there are only six classes of defender to use in the game, the customization inherent in the rpg progression system means there is the possibility of some differentiation. Additional defenders can be recruited in towns across the game's story map, wherein the plot is advanced and new battlefields are opened up. In battle, these defenders are placed with the same resource you use for upgrading, but recruiting new defenders gets progressively expensive with the game's story mode currency (won through battle). That same currency is used for equipping your defenders with weapons and armor, so there is an opportunity cost. As additional currency can be won by going back and fighting harder versions of prior story mode battles at any time, you never truly feel strapped for cash.  As the game is 2d, the question isn't whether the graphics are advanced, but how good and cohesive they look. Cut scenes to advance the plot are drawn with a style which gels extremely well with the battle sprites and look pleasing to the eye. Opinions on art styles will vary, but the cleanliness and cohesiveness of the game's visuals can not be denied. There are no sloppy looking sprites in this game and your defender's colors can even be customized to a limited degree to further suit your tastes.   Unfortunately, while the animations of your defenders (and especially that of a certain antagonist at the very end of the game) are fluid and pleasing to watch, the animations of the monsters which you are tasked to kill are very basic and stilted. Still, most of the time said monsters are drowning in a sea of pleasing damage numbers as your defenders are chopping them to pieces, so perhaps some gamers will be able to overlook this as I did.  According to steam, I was able to extract 13 hours out of this game and there are still bonus challenges to complete and a new game plus mode to experiment with. Whether that is worth the price of admission is a decision that I encourage you to weigh carefully if you would normally pass up a game based on length: it is lovingly crafted and an enjoyable experience that I can recommend to any rpg fan, even those who aren't familliar with tower defense games.  The long and short of it: 8/10, buy it.

A nice mix about: +'Final Fantasy' +'Plants vs Zombies' +'Fish vs Crab' or 'Go home dinosaurs' [Tower Defense] +Mann vs Machine (upgrates) from the game 'Team Fortress 2'  PS: Trailer-bad, Screen shots-bad; BUT demo awesome and big.

I picked this up when it was on sale, and I gotta say it has a lot charm. That being said, the writing is a bit rough around the edges, and the dialogue (with the exception of one of the big bad) falls somewhat flat. In any case, it is a solid tactical rpg with some unique mechanics that fit well with tactics genre. I definitely recommend it.

This game was amazing before the DX update, now it is even better. A take on the tower defense genre that actually innovates. If your a fan of TD's at all, or enjoy strategic gameplay, you will find a lot to enjoy here.

Amazing game, really amazing. I can probably say that it's one of the best I've bought here on Steam. The amount of gameplay time is really huge and it has a great storytelling! It's a consistent story that even explain game mechanics, so everything has meaning. I'd recommend this game to everyone, but even more for tower defense/RPG fans. 9,5/10 (I gave 9,5 though, but only for the resolution thing - only bad part of the game).
Overall above average title, quite good for an indie game. Would definitely recommend to anyone who enjoys Tower Defense. (9/10)

One of the best tower defense games I have ever played. Seriously. It is really excellent. The game is pretty grindy, but it allows you to set how quickly you gain XP and such via menu, so you can play how you want. Lots of depth with available skills, character classes, character upgrades, and items. Buy this game. The developers absolutley deserve your money.

Honestly i personally don't like Tower Defense games.Yet this one is unique,that dosen't mean I like it. You need to like these kind of games to enjoy them.For the little time I played this game,It was more good than bad.I can't do a pros/cons list becuase I havent played thus game since April of 2014.I have one problem.The price.Unless you really want this game.I'd suggest wait till its on sale.I bought it for a Dollar,only to enable steam guard,but once again for the little time I played this game.It was enjoyable.

As a tower defense game, this has the perfect balance between intense, hardcore action and careful, strategic skill mangement. There is real progression that you can customise and see working straight away, but still you have to balance your towers in-battle. Plus it gets very hard! In a word, brilliant.
With the new DX Edition this game is even better! Well done, replaying the game again.

Great game! The strategy theme is simple yet impressive for such a seemingly insignificiant game. The 6 classes are reasonably balanced but the ice mage seems slightly over powered. And it gets slightly monotenous once you have all classes full and a lvl 40 librarian but don't let that ruin the fun! Highly recommend this fun little game! 9.5/10  'I can't help feeling I'm not awesome enough!'

This game was most likely conceived in a fit of passion, on a summer's eve, between Disgaea and the popular fangame Pokemon Tower Defense.  GBA-era Fire Emblem watched, too, which is reflected in the aesthetics of the resulting lovechild.
Fun game. I keep coming back for more so I can finish the quests.
What's wrong with Defender's Quest: Valley of the Forgotten? The boss music could loop better. That's all I got.
Fun game. I keep coming back for more so I can finish the quests.
A good mixture of tower defense and RPG elements, this game has a gentle difficulty curve while still providing a challenge to expert players. The story is full of humorous moments.
Probably the best tower defense game!
Fun but I recommand legacy version, There is so many bugs in New-version
A highly addictive and interesting and charming game. I hate the retro graphics trend - but I love this game, so I suppose that says something!

At first glance, this is a decent TD.  Each map has dificulty scaling from brain-dead-easy to challenging-enough-to-keep-you-on-your-toes all the way to so-hard-you-will-have-to-come-back-once-you-have-leveled-up-more.  The story is more engaging than many RPGs and shows great humor.  The achievements are a decent mix of 'collect as you go' and 'work hard to get this'.  The upgrading and customization of your 'towers' adds a lot of strategic depth which is only hightened by the weapons and armor you buy/upgrade.  And then you finish the game and find out that there are achievements to play with just the story dependant heroes (Hero Mode). And the challenge increases by a factor of 7.  And then you finish the game doing Hero Mode and find out about New Game +  That's where the game really shines. Because not only is there a whole lot more story, greater challenge in all the previous maps, more achievements AND extra maps... there is also Hero Mode +  And then there are all the bonus maps...  The game is bursting with content, oozing challenge out of every pixel and spurting out humor.  No. Don't wait for a sale. This is not a game you MIGHT want, it is a game you can't NOT have.  PS: There is also a sequel coming. Oh, and a free HD version for everyone who has the game.  These are the kinds of devs you support. Do it.

I love this game. Bought it a few Christmas's ago and beat it in a single weekend. Almost 12 hours of gameplay in two nights. Fantastic game. If you like tower defense games, RPGs or tower-defense-RPGs, then you should most definitely buy this game.
It is a video game.

Very cool game, great for 5 minute gaming or just as something fun. Remember fun games, well this is one of them. Very cool humour.  No downsides to this game except that the modding community have  added mechianics to make the game easier to win.
Fun game with great developer support.

This is a great tower defense game with lots or RPG elements included. Instead of towers, you have heroes you position along a path to defend your leader. As these heroes fight, they level up and can be built into different styles of tower depending on the skills you take.  Pros - Lots of good tower defense gameplay - Lots of well done RPG elements so you can modify each hero and personalize your play style - Good story and interesting characters - Lots of great items to equip to make your heroes (towers) even more effective - The game rewards replay of older levels on higher difficulties by giving your heroes (towers) more experience and the ability to unlock special items - Lots of replay value with all the difficulty levels and all the things that can be unlocked. - Challenging maps that sometimes require you to think outside your normal setups.  Cons - Older graphics - Gameplay can be repetative if you're just interested in the story  Overall this is a great game that I would highly recommend to an RPG or tower defense enthusiast. The game gives you the option of both relaxed gameplay and very challening maps if you want them. (It also rewards your party for completing said maps.)

A highly-recommended tower-alike game where the difficulty ranges from 'cakewalk through the game to see the ending(s)' to 'oh my god, son, you gotta grind some more' (protip to everyone - turn XP gain to 300% in the menu, just trust me, it's helpful and if you intend to play over Basic difficulty for more gear/do the 'plot characters only' achievements you'll want this). Has an astounding new game plus feature with almost as much care put into the difficulty balance, adding sidequests, a new gear tweaking system, and a real ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ move or twelve in endgame. You also get spells to control the flow of the battle more, a half-speed option for tougher segments or micromanagement if you prefer, and none of this will ruin your sweet, sweet achievements in any way. Game wants you to play it, not get stuck in place for weeks on end.  Top 3 of its genre, guaranteed, and I only say top 3 because I know some people disagree with me on what the other two'd be. (for what it's worth I put this above Defense Grid, but I thought Defense Grid blew compared to Sol Survivor and its multiplayer).

This game was amazing back when I first got it for cheap cheap from a Steam coupon. I saw it was a tower defense game, and I said to myself, 'This is only a few bucks, I'll try it out.' Oh my, I didn't know how much I would love this game.  Defender's Quest is a tower defense game with RPG elements, mainly experience points, skill trees, and a good story inbetween the gameplay. It the game has humor, which is rather welcome. The gameplay is where this game really shines.  This is simply the best tower defense game I've ever played. You may have played a tower defense game before, but you haven't played Defender's Quest. It has a lot of depth to its gameplay, it has a very intuitive UI and an unobtrusive tutorial that is very helpful. Tutorial can be turned off entirely in the options, if you really want to. While you're at it, you can increase the experience and gold you get from the game to make it easier, or crash it into the ground and make the game harder. The music fits the game's atmosphere perfectly. I haven't even mentioned that you can mod every aspect of this game yet. Go look in the workshop; the creators of the game made a free sci-fi version of the game just to show you how much flexibility there is in regular modding.  Everything I've mentioned was made better with the recent update. I recommend this game wholeheartedly. 10/10.

I am not much of a fan at all of tower defense games. But with the 'towers' changed to units which level up over battles, and a better-than-decently-written story, I got my money's worth and then some out of this. If you like tower defense, this is a no-brainer. If you don't, it' still an excellent game by pretty awesome devs. If you are a graphics ♥♥♥♥♥, well, I'm sorry your eyes keep you from enjoying good gameplay? But other than that there's nothing to complain about here.  Also beating the game once is apparently just scratching the surface.

This game brought back refreshing memories of old school tower defence games I used to play. Unfortunately once you play a few tower defence games it seems like you have played them all. However, Defender's Quest is unlike all those other games with its humour and fantastic story to boot. I had laughed so hard at some of the comments between the characters when they interacted that I had to explain to my friends what I was laughing at. The game itself plays very well. It is not terribly difficult to beat the game, however new game + and the secrets hidden in the game are very difficult. Unfortunately it took a community of players to find all the secrets in the game, which isn't necessarily a bad thing if you like the challenge. If you are an achievement hunter this one will take some time and patience, or just some forum searching.

(9/10)   Simple defense game in an already over-crowded genre, but man they executed it to perfection. Retro 90's pixel art style, mixed with a ton of options and depth, mixed with a huge pile of scaling difficulty replay, mixed with a ton of clever scenarios and an overall mix of 'tower' people which allows alot of personalization and gives a ton of room for different play styles to all succeed.   So, yeah, if you like defense games, just get it, play it, enjoy its quirky story and characters, but stay for the *almost* never ending replayability
really good tower-defense game with rpg elements
I wanted a good, simple tower defense game, and that's what I got. With witty dialogue to back it up, this is a fun game that doesn't require any major time investment.

I just bought this today, and finished it. (Normal mode anyway...) I can say I completely recommend this title. The gameplay is surprisingly fun, even though you can really get by with a couple rangers. While I wish there was more variety in the challenge, I still very much enjoyed the game. Can't wait for Defender's Quest 2!
One of my favorite all time tower defense games! Check the hours played. Just get it!
A very clever and addicting rendition of the tower defense in a fantasy setting with lite RPG elements.
Tower defence RPG with a Zak McCracken / G-rated Tom Sharpe sense of humour and lovingly piled together pixels. Play it.

I personally loved this game. It's tower defense genre mixed with a pretty decent story kept me chugging away through two play-throughs in a time where I hardly ever finish any game. Well worth it, especially on sale.
This game is very addictive. I played it after my sister and brother-in-law bought it for me and I had trouble putting it down.
Worth 10bux or less it's actually pretty good and apparently has mods (i can't wait to replace everything with my little pony!!!!!)
DQ is a great tower defense game. DQ is my second favorite TD game, after Pixel Junk Monsters.
small game but fun guys. dont miss this!

RPG meets tower defense. I had a great time with it, and I think I can't wait for the sequel. UPDATE: This game gets even better with age. The best tower defense game I have ever played, hands down. I didn't even realize new game+ had so many added benefits. The original game was fun enough, but new game+ opens up a whole new dimension to the game. I'd go into further detail, but I really don't want to spoil it.

Yes. 10/10 would buy again. This is a example of a good tower defense game coupled with an actual story. While one could argue that the graphics are low tier and would fit more as a flashgame it deserved its placed on the steam market. Why you ask? Everything fits in the big picture. There is not a single thing that seems out of place. It's a well thought out game no plot holes to fill only loot to get.  I enjoyed playing it, revisited earlier locations to achieve my 100% on certain maps. I still didnt complete the whole game 100% because you can actually increase the game speed by a certain amount and sometimes on really busy maps the game crashes. Mostly near the end of the mission which makes it even more unforgiving.  You will get your moneys worth of tower defense, the occasional chuckle during dialogues and the fullfilling feeling of the 100% hunt.
Very very good game. I really enyoing it playing. Worth to buy.
It's a surpingly fun game. Not very complicated to learn and has enough complexity to captivate the most experienced gamers. It's fun!

This title is a quite interesting option for the Tower Defense genre. Besides having a simple and intuitive gameplay, it also has some nice graphics, a good soundtrack and also a decent story which helps with the game's immersion. Throughout the adventure you're gonna have the chance to upgrade your characters, which is something that I always thought that it was much better than just coming up with something new right away. As for the replay value, you may feel tempted to unlock some other achievements even after you're through with the main story, which is something nice, I guess. Just to finish, this is another option that offers the players trading cards, so if you're a fan of the genre, go ahead and give it a try.
Very good Tower Defense game with suprising good narrative and difficulty level

A indie tower defense game with alot of heart and soul ,backed up by rewarding players for good use of tactical placement of heros and use of powers. The story also deserves credit for being simple and easy to follow, while also having depth and complexity. The animations themselves are not impressive but between the serious and quirky story or the unyeilding waves of horrible monsters chomping at the heros the game has plenty to dig into and intices players to dig back into the game a second or even third time to experince new thrills and challenges.
i like having a nifty story in my TD! Hope more TDs do it like this
I've only played 20 minutes but the secrets button on the start page alone warrants a like!
Loved this game, simple tower defence. I can't wait for the updated 2nd!
This is one of the few tower defence game I play that I continue to play as well.
Very fun game and is almost exactly what I was looking for. An RPG (Heroes/Levels/Equipment) mixed with tower defense and strategy. Good job!
One of the best TD games out there...! Check out the developer website, you can preorder the sequel and get the first game for free.
I really enjoyed this game. Characters were nice and a few months after playing it everything still stays fresh in my head. Would recommend as a casual 2d TD :)

I only stopped playing this because it crashed, which made me notice it was 2am and I hadn't done my homework yet.  There's a flash demo online, but if you're a fan of TD type games just buy this already.

If you're looking for tower defense game where you can upgrade just about everything this is what you want. Don't worry about the story, it doesn't matter. The new game + mode is a must play as well. Lots of new things thrown in.
Classic tower defense game that has a level up feature that carries over between matches. This on top of the steam workshop make this game worth the pricetag. Especially if you can find it on sale.
One of the better tower defense games around. The story is entertaining, and I like how the characters are actually the 'towers'. Very cheap and great value!
So far Im in love with this little game and its exceeded my expectations for $1.49 cant wait to see what cool mods people make for this awsome tower deffense rpg

This game is veeeery good, not perfect because of graphics and music, but have excellent gameplay, not trivial storyline and can challenge you on difficulties higher than normal. I bought it on steam on sale with 90% discount, just to try, and this game costs at least 2x of this price.

This is a really fun game, and perfect for me as the father of a 5 month old as I can dip and out easily. The developer is really responsive on the forums and fixed a bug where achievements where not unlocking on linux for me in a matter of hours.  Quick warning for linux users though, it requires Adobe Air to be installed, which I had to jump through some serious hoops on 64 bit Ubuntu 13.10 to get working.
This is a fun strategy game, with an interesting story plot and gameplay mechanics.

This game is a surprising gem. And the writing is both interesting and laugh-out-loud hilarious, to be totally honest. I would pay the fifteen for this. I am however currently getting it for $1.50. Regardless of which way, pick it up if you're into these; you won't regret it.

This is a fun little time waster, have it running in the background when you are doing work and you can get time wasting done at the same time as you are trying to finish that important thing, and failing at getting it done quickly. fun rpg/towerdefence game and there is more to unlock after you beat the game especially if you didn't beat all the levels on max difficulty.
A fun tower/RPG game. You can level up your units (towers), each stage has rewards for difficulty completion. So you can grind rpg style in a tower game. A neat twist on two slassic game styles.
One of the few tower defense game I would play multiple times and still very much enjoy it. And developer is still supporting it with fix and new feature. You won't regard it.
Solid and entertaining tower defense with RPG elements.
Great game!!
This game is really nice! It's a bad Tower Defense game, and a bad RPG and yet, still a great game. I highly recommend.
This is a really fun game.
The best tower defense game out there!
I WILL TEAR YOUR FACES OFF AND USE YOUR SKULLS TO HOLD DECORATIVE HOUSEPLANTS
Such a great game. Good story, love the humor between the characters, but where it really shines is the gameplay.

This game was fun for a while, but it gets hard fast and will likely require some grinding to finiish.  If you like tower defense, rpgs, and grinding this game could be fun. I'm not sure I will ever play it again though and so cannot really recommend it.

The game is actually pretty short. Storyline is not that rich as well as it's presentation. The main problem with the game is the fact it lacks a new mechanics, so in the end you will play just another tower defence with a tiny hint of 'rpg'.

Must level grind characters to complete game. No tactics required. Poor targeting. Dreadful story. Worse 'Tower Defense' game I've had the misfortune of playing. Not really a tower defense game. I don't understand how this game got so many positive reviews. Avoid.
RPG mixed with tower defense. The most fun I ever had with a tower defense game, played it start to finish. The story is amusing as well.

Good Tower Defense game, with the 'towers' being people you find along the storyline, or people you can hire permanently. You can have up to 6 of each type of tower. RPG elements mostly revolve around your towers leveling up in a persistant way. In addition you buy things like weapons and armor for your towers. Furthermore your main character levels up, who acts as the endpoint of a level, and the person you're trying to protect with your towers. It has the same fallbacks as other TD games, monotony being the main one. You have to grind out levels and money to make yourself more powerful, but the game has an awesome options menu that gives you the option to speed up exp gain for units in and out of combat, as well as speeding up monetary gain, all without flagging yourself as a cheater, or denying yourself awards. Shoot one of the higher level achievements even suggests turning on increased exp gain and money gain. Great game.

This is, hands down, the best tower defense game I've ever played, and I played WarCraft 3 tower defense maps almost exclusively for an entire year in college. If you enjoy tower defense games, you MUST try this. If you've never played tower defense, I still strongly recommend trying it. There's a demo available on Steam. Try it. Buy the game. It's great. I've put about 3 hours in it so far and I'm completely hooked.

Solid writing, the story was engaging especially for a tower defense game. Character dialogue was great and got a decent amount of laughs from me. The tower defense wasn't revolutionaiy, but the RPG mechanics added in gave some nice long term benefits to investing in certain 'towers'. Levels never out-stayed their welcome while also providing a fair amount of replayability. Having the right setup and clearing your way through at 4x was satisfying. I've never been one to spend a lot of time on side-stuff after completing the main story though so I don't think I'll put any time into 100%'ing the game or new game+

A simple to learn tower defense game with a great sense of humor, Defender's Quest: Valley of the Forgotten has an enjoyable campaign. Each level can be played multiple times with different difficulty settings and greater rewards for completion. Finishing the campaign lets you play again in a harder mode that adds a few extra cut scenes to the story. Easy to jump into and play a quick level, but hard to put down after you get started. Highly recommended.
Best TD game, period

Saw this first on kongregate when the initial game was released. Loved it then, love it now. Excellent tower defense, no juggling needed. Currently at 179 gold stars /180 for hero mode++ (using only 6 of the allowed 36 units, one of each class). Excellent game, well designed. Just be sure to bump up all your xp gains to 300% and buy this game.

It's like FINAL FANTASY CRYSTAL GUARDIANS, except much better, with an art and humor overlay that is highly reminiscent of John Allison's brilliant SCARY GO ROUND webcomic. I spent more than four hours playing once I'd installed it, and I'm only about 1/6 through the game. If you like your fantasy tactics and tower defense without the portentous thud of grimdark nonsense, this is the game for you.
Nice game, where you don't feel like you're playing a Tower Defense game. =)

One of the best Tower Defence games I have played!  Your 'towers' are characters who level-up and gain abilities between fights. There are plenty of options, the game is well designed and the artwork is in the style of 2D Japanese RPGs.
Enjoyable little tower defense game with a twist and a humorous glimmer in the eye.
Very fun and addictive, thumbs up
Tower defense, strategy, thriller. Fun for all ages.

Out of all of my years playing Tower Defense games, this is one of the greatest out there. That is all there is to say. You can spend many hours on this, with great characters, compelling gameplay, entertaining dialogue, and one of the best systems of TD out there.  This game gets a 93/100.
Do you like tower defence games? Do you like RPG's? Then enjoy the creamy mixture of the two!

You should read up on Rock, Paper, Shotgun's review of this game.   There is so much to say about this game yet so little to do it justice. You just HAVE to play this version of the game, and it is worth every bit of penny you have no matter what.   'It's Brilliant.'   Yes, I agree, there really isn't much else to say, this game is fantastic to hell.

This is precisely how tower defense RPGs should be done. Your progression and choices actually matter, but there's always room to go back and correct your mistakes. There's a real sense of accomplishment when you finally beat that super-hard level on the highest difficulty. It helps that the dialogue in the cut-scenes is at least somewhat entertaining and doesn't make your ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ pucker from cringe.  There isn't a planned sequel I'm looking forward to more than this one.
Fun characters, good gameplay, and quite replayable.
This undoubtedly something of a hidden gem. The writing, scope and depth is amazing and the amount of conent on offer for only $15 is brilliant.

Everything a tower defense should be.  If this came out on SNES back in the day we would be praising it as one of the greatest hits. A retrogamer MUST HAVE  I love it. People should buy it, and enjoy.

Defender's Quest is far better than I expected. One thing that sets it apart from many tower defense games is that the story is witty and engaging. While the first few challenges are fairly easy, the difficulty increases at a good pace. There is no significant penalty for failing or restarting a mission, so the game does not punish you while you are learning. This is a very well-executed game and quite enjoyable.
I have so much fun playing this game! I have always been a fan of Tower defense games (like the KIngdom Rush series) and this one is worth buying.

One of the best Tower Defense games out there. Has pretty unique mechanics, heroes level up, change their equipment, talents etc NG+ mode with even MORE stuff.   Really great game and well worth the full price
Warning, Addictive!!!!

This game is so much fun, a tower defense game with some rpg elements. If you love tower defense, but would want some more story behind it? This is your game! The first playthrough isn't incredibly hard, still poses a challange at times though but if you lvl enough you can manage. But then you unlock New Game +, and yea.. that's a nice challenge! There is a level cap! But the game keeps getting harder! Strategy definetly required. I love it. Also be sure to read the dialogs, especially tak is hilarious and had me laughing out loud on several occasions. I still play it every now and then, have to admit i havent gotten all gold stars on newgame+ yet.. (that d*mn sheep) But i will eventually, still enjoy the challenges!  I felt compelled to change this review, because i have beaten the New Game + Sheep ! That's all.
This is a wonderful mix of tower defense and RPG progression. Great story and tough, but doable, challenges.

A very engrossing game, even for the genre. If you've ever played a tower defense game, then you know how they go and wont find much mechanically different here. What sets this game apart in my opinion is the little story that goes along with it. It makes what might normally be a slog through levels after a point a fun and engrossing game. The art also looks quite nice too, thanks to a free HD update. My only recomendation to anyone who wants to do a 'no hired mercs' run of the game is to immediately set the XP gain to 300% because the game doesn't let you know about this right away.
It is a really good combination between a tower defense game and an rpg nice story and music

Great tower defense game. I love the RPG leveling up of the characters (the 'towers'). Graphics are obviously not the game's strong points but I really didn't mind them and I liked the simple cutscenes. Has a lot of replay value and players of all skill levels can enjoy it due to the multiple difficulty settings.   There's also settings to increase XP and gold for gamers who just don't have much time to play as well as accessibility options! That's really great and more developers should add options like that!

This game is actually pretty neat. I'm not usually into the whole Tower Defense thing, but when your 'towers' are characters, it starts to get a little more personal, and a little more interesting. I'd say it's worth playing, for sure.

Definitely worth playing if you like Tower Defense games, with a lite RPG influence and elements to it.  Edit: It's a Tower Defense game where your 'towers' have RPG mechanics to them. The challenges and various difficulties make the game very hard on New Game+.

Definitely worth playing if you like Tower Defense games, with a lite RPG influence and elements to it.  Edit: It's a Tower Defense game where your 'towers' have RPG mechanics to them. The challenges and various difficulties make the game very hard on New Game+.
Amazing game. If you like Tower Defence games; even a little bit. I recommend giving this a shot. And playing it a 2nd go on new game + for a better challenge.
If you love RPG's and Tower Defense, buy it.

This is a game where battles take place in a tower defense style, but you progress by roaming around a map while fighting these battles. Has elements of the old Shining Force / Disgaea games where:  1. Characters gain levels and advance 2. Strategic placement of characters during the battle is important 3. You can go back and replay old battles for more experience   You select the difficulty of each battle before you run it. Doing old battles at higher difficulties yeilds higher rewards. The game is progressive without feeling too grind-ish.
Tower defense RPG... This is a great game, I only have 2 negatives comments 1. It's to short 2. There is a steep spike in difficulty   That said, Buy this game  9/10
Highly recommended for any tower defense fan, the well written story is both amusing and compelling.

This game has nice tactic choices, very well done story and some decent replayability especially if your a wanting all the achievements. I know sometimes tower defenses can get repetative but this game still keeps you jumping on the harder difficulties as things have a few tweaks to throw you off of normal patterns. I highly recommend the game as the story gets a bit more interesting on Play+ mode with the main characters diary to read.
Love this game it is so awesome. More than worth the fifteen dollars.
Super fun, relaxing, easy to pick up and put down. A very good classic tower defense game.

Excellent (and often humorous! ;) storyline - very rare for this genre of game, intuitive (but deep) mechanics, and engaging, well-crafted music - there's _nothing_ to not like about this tower defense game.

Clever is the word for this game. The gameplay is tight, well-balanced, and clever. Tower defense games are rarely this clever and the RPG system rewards good play. The downfall of virtually all RPG systems is a sense of grind - you want the best stuff, you're going to have to perform repetitive tasks until you've got the prerequisite numbers. Grinding reminds me of a job. Defender's Quest lets you bypass that - anything you'd have to grind for is optional, and if you want the optional content, then you can toggle the exp and gold gain. This also lets you set the difficulty to as difficult or as easy as you want.  The amazing thing is that the gameplay is so good, and the rest of the game is also so good. The graphics aren't the modern blockbusters, but the character art is charming and clever, and the dialog is well-written and allows you to connect to the characters. Fun gameplay, thoughtful gameplay, good art, good dialog, fun plot. The game can even be replayed, and the new game+ has additional insight into the world if you're that hooked. It also ramps up the difficulty if you like a challenge. To top it off, the game is inexpensive. Why have you not already bought it?
Magnificent game! That mix of tower defense+rpg. Dialogs, sounds and graphics really good. The only counter, which's a shame, its that the game was made in adobe air ):
Really fun with a nice twist on the Tower defence genre.

I really like this game. The story is interesting, the gameplay is the basic tower defence but with a twist( the skills and the different ''heroes'' you get) and the rpg element is also nice because it lets you develop your playstyle more. Overall a pretty good game.

Defender's Quest is an enjoyable tower defense style game with character progression that extends beyond individual maps. It features a small branching skill tree for each class, a variety of difficulty levels with corresponding rewards, and incentives to play beyond the ten hour story.

A seemingly simple, yet very well balanced mixture of tower defense, rpg and a nice story. The battles are challenging and adjust very well to your current skill, heroes and equipment. You can spend quite a lot of time on this gem and still discover new tactics and game mechanics.

6/10  -= READ =-  Don't be fooled with the rating even though I recommend this. I've spent hours analyzing while playing this game. It all boils down to several pros/cons   + You can level up your units + You can go back to the stage you've done to train + Each stage has different level settings and rewards so you don't have to toggle difficulty + Different combinations to try out + Story is funny as much as it is serious + Multiple Endings?  - Story does get boring so I'm glad theres comedy in it - After awhile, you get tired of the grind - Story is short - Once you reach that point where you're no longer playing but 'working' through the game. Typical for most rpgs - Limited content   With that said, I still recommend this game. It leaves you to wonder how much potential it has and hope the devs do a much better version next installment. It was enjoyable while it last. And don't let the price scare you. If you guys actually spent time learning how much time, effort and your own money is spent to develop the game... you wouldn't be b**ching and moaning about games being expensive. That's why you read reviews like this to help you make a better decision :P

A solid casual tower defense game; basically everything the sales blub says. Defender's Quest is probably the closest game to Plants vs Zombies in terms of combining flexible strategy, casual accessibility, and general charm. Combined with the low price, you can't go wrong with this one.
halarious this  game is, a steal when on sale  many laughs abound
One of the best Turret Defense games I have ever played. The storytelling is outstanding and the gameplay is actually refreshingly new for this very overused genre of game.

Surprisingly fun game packaged in an old school tower defense with a feeling of a “flash game”. Skillfully bundled with heavy rpg elements such as items, skill increases and trees. The story line is somewhat comical and easy to follow, and the joy of destroying countless mobs with arrows and sword is what reassures this game’s replay ability.

This is a pretty straightforward, classic Tower Defense game. That being said, it is one of the most solid Tower Defense games that I have ever played. It comes with a lot of character and a lot of options. I bought it for full price. I think it is justifiable at full price considering how much I like tower defense. On sale there is no reason to pass this up.

Really fun mix of RPG elements and Tower Defense. As with most games, I grabbed it for cheap on a sale, and if you happen to spot it the next time it goes, and enjoy those two genres of games, then you should too.

This is easily one of the best Tower Defense games ever made. First played it years ago when it was first released direct on their own website, and it's still just as good today. Funny, deep, tactical, story-driven - everything you could wish for from a TD game. Now if only they ported it to mobile...

This was a good play.   Short and sweet: Light story, simple system, intriguing game.   It's a classic tower defense game given a different take (it plays like any other tower defense - the ones that dont require you to maze, and to just build towers to take down opponents - but feels more like an RPG than a TD). It does it well, too, may I say.  Looking into 100% achievement rate; hopefully in the nearby future.  Update: I'm nowhere near 100%. I hit the level cap so overpowering them isn't the answer so much as having a proper working strategy. Things just became much more difficult.
This game is so good I've bought it twice, once on the original place I found it: kongregate and again on here!
This is basically a tower defense game just with people who can die...  Not a bad game, alot of reptiveness needed to levelup characters.  If you like tower defense games then you should like this.
The perfect tower defense game.

This is an awesome game. I was not expecting this to be as deep as it is. It's tower defense, sure, but it also has RPG elements and a bit of XCOM as well. You name characters and add them to your party. They level up and equip weapons and armour and serve as your 'towers' during 'defense'. The gameplay is nothing revolutionary, but it's the secondary stuff that sets this one apart.

If you are a tower defense fan, or someone who likes JRPGs, buy this game. It is the perfect blend, resulting in a casual game with a high skill cap. If a level is too hard, just go back to an earlier level to level up your heroes, maybe even get some new equipment.  If you're more hardcore, the 'one hero per class' challenge is a ton of fun, and really stresses your skill at tower defenses.
Very fun little TD game, if you see it 10 dollars or under it's well worth it
Pretty cool tower defence game, but by the time it was over I was definitely ready for it to be over.

This game is really addicting and a lot of fun; the writing is pretty entertaining and the mechanics are solid. As advertised, it's tower defense + rpg electric boogaloo--but I found myself enjoying it in a similar vein to tactical rpgs. You follow the general progression of getting 'hero' characters of each class, but can then also fill out your ranks with others of their ilk as you go; completing challenges or higher difficulties of battles can often end up netting you new gear to kit out your characters with and overall I found that a lot of fun. I recommend this game.~

Wow. Where do I start? Well you might as well buy this game and start installing it while I tell you about it. It's a tower defence RPG. Your towers are the various characters you recruit/hire. They gain xp, level up, need equipment, learn new skills, just like RPG characters. It's beautifully simple yet intrinsically addictive. It's funny in cartoony way (The static cutscenes grated at first but after a while I enjoyed them) and the sprite graphics are great. This is a real little gem, I love it.
If you like tower defense, buy this game. The tower defense genre you know and love with RPG elements.

One of my all time favorite games. A perfect blend of RPG and tower defense, this game has great strategic depth, a fun story and characters, and massive replay value. I'm greatly looking forward to the sequel.
Fun tower defence with a good story.

Great Game. I never play with tower defense games, they are boring.. At first glance this seemed like one of them, but it's not boring at all, and you don't think about tower defense style for a second.. I played it trough once (~23 hours, but I went for the maximum star level achivements). My biggest problem was, that it freezed 4 times in total. My video settings are full screen and widened, and sometimes at the biggest battles close to victory the screen jumped back into windowed mode and it froze. I had to play those battles again..

I really love this game. I love the mash-up of RPG leveling and tower defense gameplay, and I'm perfectly happy replaying levels at increasing difficulty. The storyline isn't your usual cup of tea, either, and it's nice to see something new. I highly recommend this game to anyone who likes RPGs or tower defense games.
Great game! Finishing the missions gives a great feeling of accomplishment.
Awesome game. Best Tower Defense I've ever played.
It is a really good combination between a tower defense game and an rpg nice story and music

Great tower defense game. I love the RPG leveling up of the characters (the 'towers'). Graphics are obviously not the game's strong points but I really didn't mind them and I liked the simple cutscenes. Has a lot of replay value and players of all skill levels can enjoy it due to the multiple difficulty settings.   There's also settings to increase XP and gold for gamers who just don't have much time to play as well as accessibility options! That's really great and more developers should add options like that!

This game is actually pretty neat. I'm not usually into the whole Tower Defense thing, but when your 'towers' are characters, it starts to get a little more personal, and a little more interesting. I'd say it's worth playing, for sure.
This game is a great tower defense game! Good RPG elements and decent story, with an added little bit of replayability. On sale, you can't beat this purchase. It is fun!

I had fun playing this game. The gameplay is interesting and fun, and the game has a sense of humor, which is nice. There's lots of postgame stuff if you're into that sort of thing, but then the standard game is fine as well. :)

Great game. I love the story, the characters, and world. Great accessibility menu for hardcore and more casual players alike.  My only complaint is that there is a lot of stuff in New Game+ that felt like it should've just been left in the first playthrough. A normal play through feels like a light rpg experience you might get on a mobile game. The New Game+ on the other game actually feels more like a great new addition for RPG and Tower Defense fans alike.  PS- If you are a completionist, or just want to challenge yourself, there is an achievement for finishing the game without hiring any generic units. You basically have to win the game with only one of each unit type. It can be done, and I actually found the game more fun to play this way.

if you like tower defense you could do worse than this game. it starts off pretty easy and with a pretty generic 'story' but gets a lot tougher and more interesting. There is some repetitiveness in the game but while you do some of the maps over you also unlock rewards and items to power up your 'towers' (troops)

If you are a tower defense fan, or someone who likes JRPGs, buy this game. It is the perfect blend, resulting in a casual game with a high skill cap. If a level is too hard, just go back to an earlier level to level up your heroes, maybe even get some new equipment.  If you're more hardcore, the 'one hero per class' challenge is a ton of fun, and really stresses your skill at tower defenses.

Yes, yes, and yes. This is an excellent tower defense!  Defender's quest knows what's important and what's not. Graphics are minimal and sprite-based, and keyboard controls are almost enough to forego the mouse.  The music is catchy and fitting.  Gameplay has enough decisions in tower placement, upgrades, and equipment that replaying levels for awards isn't tedious. The story and dialog are humorous and of appropriate lengths while remaining interesting and giving the game purpose. Warning: vets will be challenged by the (selectable) high level of difficulty.   Skipping this game would be a mistake.
Great tower defense, interesting story, hours of gameplay

If you like tower defense, this is a fun one. Lots of options. Your 'towers' are people and they can level up, different skill trees. There's also various equipment (both store bought and uniques you can get). They did a huge content patch to gold edition a while back, I need to go replay it and see the additions (I first played this back when it started on kongregate before that). Watch the video or try the free demo.

Defender's Quest is a simple turn based tower defense game. Defenders are set up on a grid, and enemy units follow a path to the goal. The units are well balanced and versatile, and the enemies return the favor. You can set the pace of the battles at anytime, from a complete pause, to 4x 'get this over with' speed. You also have the option to control the difficulty to be as easy or as hard as you prefer. Harder the challenge, the bigger the payoff. Real strategy players are going to find the regular game a little too easy, but the game does offer unique challenges for the elite. Gamers new to strategy games will find it very welcoming. It is a game for every level of gamer, from casual beginner, to advanced tactician.
This is the sort of game that gets you hooked. You start playing, and can't get enough. I highly reccomend this to any fan of tower defense games. It breathes a fresh breeze of air into the genre!

This is actually a pretty solid game - the troop variety could have been wider, and some of them just never are as good as the others, ultimately (archers are astounding, and dragons are cool but, ultimately, overpriced for what they offer. :( )  It's really a tower defense in spirit, but has some neat little RPG elements, with some progression of your wizard/caster person, as well as your troops, who each have a little skill tree and stuff. For the price, and supporting a small studio, well worth it.  Graphics are decent - the art is so so at best, the pixel work is much more pleasant than the 'cutscenes', which no offense intended, are tacky at best. The story is decent, but is sorta held back by some kinda ridiculous one-liner attempts at humor and non-sequitor silliness, but all that said, I would say I enjoyed the game all in all.
Did not expect to like this. But holy crap, it's a very well done Tower Def game! Very impressive. That takes a lot for me to say when it comes to a TD game. I play them all...
HANDS DOWN my favorite game in my entire steam library. Completed it multiple times. If you like Tower defense or just RPGs in general and your on the cusp of getting this,  JUST DO IT!
Great game play. Great story. Funny dialog. One of the best defense games I have played with plenty of replay value.

My Favorite TD game of all time. They got jokes. They got action. They got new game +. On top of all that, its just plain fun. Oh, and mods n' stuff. Just saw the HD release...Got it for free for already owning the older version. Going to go back and beat this game....again. The value here is through the roof. Can't say enough good stuff about the Devs: Want Moar!

With the update, I've should update this review. With the improved looks, which was my main issue, the question is it is worth the full price now? Just about, yes. I would still recommend playing the demo.  There are still issues, but I feels like they are personal issues like the the skill system is somewhat off to me. Important part, to me. So overall, a fairly good game for it price.  *old review* It a good game. Why is my review not Recommended? It eleven pounds! If it was a fiver, that would be fine, but 11?  It look a flash game, it play like a flash game, but you can feel the work and effort put into this game. If you pay the full price, you will feel ripped off playing it.  So unless the price has gone down or it in a sale, avoid. If it in a sale putting it near that 5, buy for these guys deservse it and it a game any fan of TDs.   If you are not a fan of TDs, go to kongregate, you can play the first act for free and see if you like it.
One of the best Tower Defense games released so far. Although the story itself is not that interesting and attention worth, the gameplay and leveling system is just marvelous!

This game is so awesome. there is not a single aspect i did not enjoy about this title. The gameplay is fun, the story is engaging and the music is awesome. In fact i am listening to it as i right this review. So overall this game is worth the fifteen bucks or even $50
Honestly, I played through the entirety of this game forever ago and still to this day it's the best tower defense game I have ever played.

This is one of the few TDs that I can stand, mainly due to the cast of characters. In this TD your towers are characters, that you will place on predefined maze, in order to stop the creeps from getting to Azra (the main character). The characters have persistent level ups (RPG), along side traditional tower level ups (TD), this makes that game a bit easier to manage when it comes to placing them on the battlefield. Characters automatically attack and chose which ability to attack with, unless otherwise told not to use an ability. Azra has several spells that can fight back against the oncoming hordes such as healing all placed characters and raining down fireballs to continuously burn enemies.   In the game Azra has been tossed into the pit for contracting the plague, which she quickly overcomes to meet a loopy swordsman. The game manages to walk that fine line between seriousness and humor throughout the campaign. As you make your journey across the over-map you gained more survivors to your band with anywhere from 7-37 characters in your company, however only 7 are story related the rest are just generic copies of Azra 6 followers. You can assign all characters in your party with names other than the default ones, and generic defenders can be assign a color schema. There is a hard level cap of 60 for all characters, therefore you will not be able to max all characters abilities (higher difficulties you will have prioritize the best move set for your characters).    This is game is design philosophy has the old school mentality when it comes to unlockables: new game plus that adds sidequests/challenge maps (like fighting waves upon waves of sheep), harder story maps, and journal entries, books to equip Azra, unique weapons and armor/ their upgrades. Game allows you to fine to how easy or hard you want the game to be like granting no exp upon failure, increase the speed of the game. The game is very well supported by the developer, in fact received an HD upgrade without making the user pay for it again.   TL:DR highlights      humorous characters     a TD game with an actual plot     persistent level ups     free HD version and soundtrack     new game plus

Just a fantastic game. This is the gold-standard for defence games in both mechanics and story. If you like TD games, buy this.  Also, important to note is the great array of accessability options for people who might need them.

I've played the CRAP outta this game, long before it was on Steam. Tower Defense with RPG Elements. Its pulled off well. The story is pretty good for what it is. Tons of replayability. Tons of bonus missions. Tons of character customability. Has a GREAT demo, and your progress/character data transfers over to the full game. If NOTHING ELSE check out the demo. But seriously, if Tower Defense/RPG hybrid sounded at all interesting, just get it.  Update: The new Deluxe edition update, which was free to everyone who already owned the game, is pretty good. The game no longer runs in Adobe Air/Flash, which is a nice change. The updated graphics are nice, if only somewhat incremental (not that that is bad, the game looked fine already). I think its a great upgrade.

Loving this game! The story so far is really fun with all the crazy characters and keeps it nice and light :) The challenges are fun to do and rewardyou with great items and whatnots. There is a big RPG element, which is probably the only reason I bought the game on the first place. If you are a hardcore tower defence lover i do not think that you would enjoy this as much, but for the more casual players the game rocks. 10/10 Looking forward to the second part :)

This game may not have cutting-edge graphics, but it sure has a lot of heart. Defender's Quest is a strange combination of the tower defense and RPG genres, and it's one of my very favorite games in either genre. Through the game's substantial and satisfying campaign, you'll assemble a motley crew of heroes who serve as your 'towers' in this tower defense game. Unlike towers, however, your heroes will level up as they gain experience, and you can assign various skills and pieces of equipment to them. It's fun stuff.  The developers for this game are fantastic, and their continued work on Defender's Quest highlights their 'long tail' philosophy. Rather than abandoning their game after release, Level Up Labs have diligently improved upon their work, adding content, improving the graphics, and rebuilding the engine. Defender's Quest is far more refined now than it was upon release, and its developers ought to be proud.   Defender's Quest is an excellent game with a committed development team, and I very much look forward to its in-development sequel.

Great game   It has good music , graphics and animation is smooth  The story is interesting, altough I think that the game should have been longer Characters are great and it has humor in it I'd recommend it to everyone even those who don't like tower defense games should give it a try
Easily one of the best tower defense games available. Good gameplay, good replayability, and a good story which isn't something you expect from TD games.
A good tower defence game with rpg elements
I have spent countless hours on this game and even when i step away for months, it's just as fun to play when I come back. Can't wait for number two!

I really enjoy the rpg elements added into this tower game. Things can get rather grindy though once you get a lot of units, especially if you want good equipment for them and 3 stars in all levels. Overall a very fun game, if you don't mind some grinding.
